de.lessvoid.nifty

Class NiftyCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lessvoid.nifty.NiftyCanvas

  • public class NiftyCanvas
extends Object
    This can be used to draw. The actual content a NiftyNode displays is a NiftyCanvas.
    Author:
    void

      • bezierCurveTo

        public void bezierCurveTo(double cp1x,
                          double cp1y,
                          double cp2x,
                          double cp2y,
                          double x,
                          double y)
        The bezierCurveTo() method adds a point to the current path by using the specified control points that represent a cubic Bezier curve. A cubic bezier curve requires three points. The first two points are control points that are used in the cubic Bezier calculation and the last point is the ending point for the curve. The starting point for the curve is the last point in the current path. If a path does not exist, use the beginPath() and moveTo() methods to define a starting point.
        Parameters:
        cp1x - control point 1 x
        cp1y - control point 1 y
        cp2x - control point 2 x
        cp2y - control point 2 y
        x - end point x
        y - end point y

      • arc

        public void arc(double x,
                double y,
                double r,
                double startAngle,
                double endAngle)
        The arc() method creates an arc/curve (used to create circles, or parts of circles).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the center of the circle
        y - The y-coordinate of the center of the circle
        r - The radius of the circle
        startAngle - The starting angle, in radians (0 is at 3 o'clock position of the arc's circle)
        endAngle - The ending angle, in radians.

      • arcTo
